body:
with very little knowledge about it, i would have to say this is unavoidable, at least in the near future. when moving a folder it has to go through the virtual filesystem and check from where - to where - the files has to be moved. it could in principle be from dropbox to google drive.
imagine in a home network moving a folder with a 1.7 gb movie from one pc to the other. it's a rather complicated operation network wise, but you have a fast connection, and it's within the same local network.
it's not like changing an inode, it's moving while a lot of data and keeping the cache updated at the same time.

i have tried to move 19 files with a total of 801mb using owncloud web interface and i spend 10 seconds waiting the webpage to reload. copy the same amount of files over lan using ssh was less than 2 minutes.

i also tried to copy 642 files with a total of 847mb using owncloud web interface and i spend 4 minutes. moving the same folder in dropbox using the web interface was 12 seconds and copy the same over lan with ssh was again a bit less than 2 minutes. and to move a folder in a unix system in command line is instantaneous.

dropbox also has a progress bar to report the user about the progress. and all the process of indexing files into the database, etc is made in the moment of the move, not when the page is reloaded to see the files in the new possition.

i’m closing this bug because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means it’s not reproducible or it has been fixed.

please reopen if the error still persists with owncloud 5.0.9 (the latest stable version) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md).

thank you!
